summary: Boostly project: a shareable-link website providing tips to help users grow social media accounts, with additional goals to offer an official Boostly app accessible from the website and enable monetization/payment connections.
architectural_notes: Search indexing/keywords should cover broad topic-based queries (not limited to platform names), mapping searches to relevant guidance sections/content.

Search indexing and content taxonomy should include explicit content-type categories (e.g., personal/real-life, mental health/emotional, educational, entertainment, aesthetic/creative, music/audio, fashion/beauty, motivational/inspirational) and allow matching across multiple platforms (TikTok/Instagram/YouTube/Snapchat) rather than platform-only queries.

Monetization is now in scope: evaluate supported payment providers (e.g., Apple Pay via a processor like Stripe) and/or click-based revenue mechanisms (ads/affiliate links) including attribution/tracking requirements.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive, multi-section marketing website focused on "ways to help build your social media account" with clear navigation and scannable content.

Add practical growth guidance content covering: profile optimization, content strategy, consistency/scheduling, engagement/community, hashtags/SEO, analytics/iteration, and cross-promotion/collaboration.
Ensure the site is easily shareable and accessible as a single public entry point (a clear landing route) with a prominent call-to-action button that scrolls to the tips/resources sections.
Apply a coherent, distinct visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a social-media growth guide, and use it consistently across the site.
Add generated static images to improve visual polish (hero illustration and small section icons) and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image serving).

Update the website branding to use the name “Boostly” anywhere the product/site name is shown, including: the top navigation brand text and logo letter, the footer brand text and logo letter, and the browser tab title.
Add a visible, copyable “Boostly link” on the landing page that shows the current site URL and allows the user to copy it to the clipboard.
Improve link-sharing metadata so that when the site URL is shared, the preview title uses the “Boostly” name.

Add new guidance content to the Boostly website explaining practical ways to be relatable as a teenager when posting content on TikTok and Instagram, and surface this content in the existing Platform Tips section.
Add a search bar to the Boostly website that lets visitors search the site’s guidance content by what they want to create (e.g., YouTube or TikTok) and by general keywords.
Implement an on-page search results experience that presents matching items and allows users to jump to the relevant section/content location.
Ensure the search UI is responsive and accessible (keyboard navigation, labels, focus states) and works within the existing navigation patterns for both desktop and mobile.

Add a new static guidance content collection covering a broad range of content topics and strategies (including sensitive topics like depression/anxiety, hobby/learning topics like baking, and collaboration/learning-with-others themes), and render it as a visible on-page section so search results can scroll to matching items.

Extend the on-page search index and matching logic to include the new broad-topic guidance items and improve query matching to handle multi-word queries (e.g., "content about anxiety" or "baking with friends") with reasonable relevance ordering.

Update the search bar helper text to reflect broader searchable topics (not just platforms) and adjust the empty-state guidance to suggest general topic examples like mental health, hobbies, and collaboration, using English user-facing text.

For any guidance content that references depression/anxiety or other mental health topics, include a clear, non-alarming disclaimer in the content that it is not medical advice and encourages seeking help from qualified professionals or trusted people when needed.

Add a new static guidance content collection for searchable content-type tips (e.g., Relatable content, Personal / Real-Life, Mental Health & Emotional, Educational, Entertainment, Aesthetic & Creative, Music & Audio, Fashion & Beauty, Motivational & Inspirational), written in English and structured similarly to existing guidance content so the search system can index it reliably.
Render the new content-type guidance collection as a visible on-page section with stable element IDs per item so search results can scroll to the matching item location.

Extend the on-page search index and search matching to include the new content-type guidance items (title, description, tips, keywords, and disclaimers) so users can search for content categories (e.g., "relatable", "aesthetic", "fashion", "music", "motivational") as well as platform names.
Add Snapchat to the platform tips content and UI so search can return Snapchat-specific tips and users can browse them in the Platform Tips section.

Update the search input placeholder and empty-state helper text to include examples covering both platforms and content types (including Snapchat and "relatable" / "aesthetic" / "fashion"), using English user-facing text.
Add a navigation entry that allows users to jump to the new content-type guidance section using the same navigation pattern as existing sections (desktop and mobile).

Add an installable Progressive Web App (PWA) configuration for Boostly so the website can be installed as an “official app” on mobile and desktop (home screen / app launcher), including a web app manifest, app icons, and required meta tags.
Implement offline-friendly app shell caching so the installed Boostly app loads reliably with a basic offline experience (cache the main HTML/CSS/JS bundle and static generated assets).

Add a visible “Get the Boostly App” entry point on the website that lets users access installation instructions and installation actions (where supported) from within the existing page navigation patterns.
Add a prominent call-to-action on the landing/hero area that links to the new “Get the Boostly App” section without breaking existing “Get Started / View Tips” behavior.

Add a new on-page section that explains, in English, how to accept payments from the Boostly site using outbound payment links for Apple Pay (Apple Wallet) and Cash App, and provide clear call-to-action buttons/links that open the user’s payment pages in a new tab.
Add a new navigation entry (desktop + mobile) that scrolls to the new payments/monetization section using the existing on-page navigation pattern.

Add an FAQ entry (English) that answers how payments work on the Boostly site, specifically addressing Apple Pay (Apple Wallet) and Cash App links, and clarifying that ‘getting paid per click’ requires using monetized links (e.g., affiliate links, ads) or payment links rather than direct on-page Apple Wallet/Cash App collection.

Implement optional outbound click tracking for the payment CTAs so Boostly can record how many times visitors click the Apple Pay and Cash App buttons, and display the click counts in the payments/monetization section.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a website reachable via a shareable link that provides content on ways to help build/grow a social media account.
Brand the website as “Boostly” and provide/share a URL link using the Boostly name.
Add guidance content to the Boostly site on how to be relatable as a teenager on TikTok and Instagram when posting content.
Add a search bar so visitors can search for content ideas/guidance by what they’re trying to make (e.g., YouTube or TikTok).

Expand the Boostly search feature so users can search for any topic related to content creation and strategy across a broad range of subjects (e.g., mental health topics like depression/anxiety, hobbies like baking, collaboration/learning with others), not just platform-based queries.

Expand Boostly search/indexed guidance so users can search for tips by specific content type/category (e.g., Personal/Real-Life, Mental Health & Emotional, Educational, Entertainment, Aesthetic & Creative, Music & Audio, Fashion & Beauty, Motivational/Inspirational) across platforms like TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, Snapchat.
Create an official Boostly app that users can access/download from the Boostly website.

Add website monetization/payment support by connecting Apple Pay/Apple Wallet and Cash App (or alternatives) and implementing a way to earn revenue from user clicks (e.g., ads/affiliate links/tracking).
